climbs.name: Vitamin R
climbs.fa: Steve Reneker, Ben Chapman & Ken Taylor

content.description:
Starts down and left from

Farting Horse

(5.10c) and tackles the chossy southeast arete of the formation. Boulder up onto a plate (crux) and continue, if you dare, up the grainy arete to the top with sparse protection. Easy descent down the west face of the formation. Zero stars out of five; fewer if it were possible.
content.protection: meager rack to 2.5", include slings for tieoffs

climbs.name: This Bud's For You
climbs.fa: Steve Reneker, Ben Chapman & Ken Taylor

content.description:
Begin right of

Farting Horse

at ground level and climb the featured northeast arete of the formation on somewhat good rock. This is the best route here, but that's isn't much of an endorsement. Zero stars out of five.

climbs.name: Farting Horse
climbs.fa: Steve Reneker, Ben Chapman & Ken Taylor

content.description:
Start off ledges in the center if the east face and climb interesting moves on gritty rock past two bolts into a sharp thin crack with plates. Gear belay and easy downclimb off the back of the formation.

This does have some fun moves but it features all of 20' of climbing and the rock is fairly sharp and grainy. Zero stars out of five.
